014package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
015
016import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
017import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
018import edu.wpi.first.hal.SimBoolean;
019import edu.wpi.first.hal.SimDevice;
020import edu.wpi.first.hal.SimDouble;

025// CHECKSTYLE.OFF: TypeName

031/** This class is for the ADIS16448 IMU that connects to the RoboRIO MXP port. */
032@SuppressWarnings({"PMD.RedundantFieldInitializer", "PMD.ImmutableField"})
033public class ADIS16448_IMU implements AutoCloseable, Sendable {
034  // ADIS16448 Register Map Declaration
035  private static final int FLASH_CNT = 0x00; // Flash memory write count
036
037  private static final int XGYRO_OUT = 0x04; // X-axis gyroscope output
038  private static final int YGYRO_OUT = 0x06; // Y-axis gyroscope output
039  private static final int ZGYRO_OUT = 0x08; // Z-axis gyroscope output
040  private static final int XACCL_OUT = 0x0A; // X-axis accelerometer output
041  private static final int YACCL_OUT = 0x0C; // Y-axis accelerometer output
042  private static final int ZACCL_OUT = 0x0E; // Z-axis accelerometer output
043  private static final int XMAGN_OUT = 0x10; // X-axis magnetometer output
044  private static final int YMAGN_OUT = 0x12; // Y-axis magnetometer output
045  private static final int ZMAGN_OUT = 0x14; // Z-axis magnetometer output
046  private static final int BARO_OUT = 0x16; // Barometer pressure measurement, high word
047  private static final int TEMP_OUT = 0x18; // Temperature output
048  private static final int XGYRO_OFF = 0x1A; // X-axis gyroscope bias offset factor
049  private static final int YGYRO_OFF = 0x1C; // Y-axis gyroscope bias offset factor
050  private static final int ZGYRO_OFF = 0x1E; // Z-axis gyroscope bias offset factor
051  private static final int XACCL_OFF = 0x20; // X-axis acceleration bias offset factor
052  private static final int YACCL_OFF = 0x22; // Y-axis acceleration bias offset factor
053  private static final int ZACCL_OFF = 0x24; // Z-axis acceleration bias offset factor
054  private static final int XMAGN_HIC = 0x26; // X-axis magnetometer, hard iron factor
055  private static final int YMAGN_HIC = 0x28; // Y-axis magnetometer, hard iron factor
056  private static final int ZMAGN_HIC = 0x2A; // Z-axis magnetometer, hard iron factor
057  private static final int XMAGN_SIC = 0x2C; // X-axis magnetometer, soft iron factor
058  private static final int YMAGN_SIC = 0x2E; // Y-axis magnetometer, soft iron factor
059  private static final int ZMAGN_SIC = 0x30; // Z-axis magnetometer, soft iron factor
060  private static final int GPIO_CTRL = 0x32; // GPIO control
061  private static final int MSC_CTRL = 0x34; // MISC control
062  private static final int SMPL_PRD = 0x36; // Sample clock/Decimation filter control
063  private static final int SENS_AVG = 0x38; // Digital filter control
064  private static final int SEQ_CNT = 0x3A; // MAGN_OUT and BARO_OUT counter
065  private static final int DIAG_STAT = 0x3C; // System status
066  private static final int GLOB_CMD = 0x3E; // System command
067  private static final int ALM_MAG1 = 0x40; // Alarm 1 amplitude threshold
068  private static final int ALM_MAG2 = 0x42; // Alarm 2 amplitude threshold
069  private static final int ALM_SMPL1 = 0x44; // Alarm 1 sample size
070  private static final int ALM_SMPL2 = 0x46; // Alarm 2 sample size
071  private static final int ALM_CTRL = 0x48; // Alarm control
072  private static final int LOT_ID1 = 0x52; // Lot identification number
073  private static final int LOT_ID2 = 0x54; // Lot identification number
074  private static final int PROD_ID = 0x56; // Product identifier
075  private static final int SERIAL_NUM = 0x58; // Lot-specific serial number
076
077  /** ADIS16448 calibration times. */
078  public enum CalibrationTime {
079    /** 32 ms calibration time. */
080    _32ms(0),
081    /** 64 ms calibration time. */
082    _64ms(1),
083    /** 128 ms calibration time. */
084    _128ms(2),
085    /** 256 ms calibration time. */
086    _256ms(3),
087    /** 512 ms calibration time. */
088    _512ms(4),
089    /** 1 s calibration time. */
090    _1s(5),
091    /** 2 s calibration time. */
092    _2s(6),
093    /** 4 s calibration time. */
094    _4s(7),
095    /** 8 s calibration time. */
096    _8s(8),
097    /** 16 s calibration time. */
098    _16s(9),
099    /** 32 s calibration time. */
100    _32s(10),
101    /** 64 s calibration time. */
102    _64s(11);
103
104    private final int value;
105
106    CalibrationTime(int value) {
107      this.value = value;
108    }
109  }
110
111  /** IMU axes. */
112  public enum IMUAxis {
113    /** The IMU's X axis. */
114    kX,
115    /** The IMU's Y axis. */
116    kY,
117    /** The IMU's Z axis. */
118    kZ
119  }
120
121  private static final double kGrav = 9.81;
122
123  // User-specified yaw axis
124  private IMUAxis m_yaw_axis;

129  private double[] m_offset_data_gyro_rate_z;

135  private double m_accel_x = 0.0;

138  private double m_mag_x = 0.0;
139  private double m_mag_y = 0.0;
140  private double m_mag_z = 0.0;
141  private double m_baro = 0.0;
142  private double m_temp = 0.0;
143
144  // IMU gyro offset variables
145  private double m_gyro_rate_offset_x = 0.0;
146  private double m_gyro_rate_offset_y = 0.0;
147  private double m_gyro_rate_offset_z = 0.0;
148  private int m_avg_size = 0;
149  private int m_accum_count = 0;
150
151  // Integrated gyro angle variables
152  private double m_integ_gyro_angle_x = 0.0;
153  private double m_integ_gyro_angle_y = 0.0;
154  private double m_integ_gyro_angle_z = 0.0;
155
156  // Complementary filter variables
157  private double m_dt = 0.0;
158  private double m_alpha = 0.0;
159  private static final double kTau = 1.0;
160  private double m_compAngleX = 0.0;
161  private double m_compAngleY = 0.0;
162  private double m_accelAngleX = 0.0;
163  private double m_accelAngleY = 0.0;
164
165  // State variables
166  private volatile boolean m_thread_active = false;
167  private CalibrationTime m_calibration_time = CalibrationTime._32ms;
168  private volatile boolean m_first_run = true;
169  private volatile boolean m_thread_idle = false;
170  private boolean m_auto_configured = false;
171  private boolean m_start_up_mode = true;
172
173  // Resources
174  private SPI m_spi;
175  private SPI.Port m_spi_port;
176  private DigitalInput m_auto_interrupt;
177  private DigitalInput m_reset_in;
178  private DigitalOutput m_status_led;
179  private Thread m_acquire_task;
180  private boolean m_connected;
181
182  private SimDevice m_simDevice;
183  private SimBoolean m_simConnected;
184  private SimDouble m_simGyroAngleX;
185  private SimDouble m_simGyroAngleY;
186  private SimDouble m_simGyroAngleZ;
187  private SimDouble m_simGyroRateX;
188  private SimDouble m_simGyroRateY;
189  private SimDouble m_simGyroRateZ;
190  private SimDouble m_simAccelX;
191  private SimDouble m_simAccelY;
192  private SimDouble m_simAccelZ;

229
230  /** Creates a new ADIS16448_IMU object. */
231  public ADIS16448_IMU() {
232    this(IMUAxis.kZ, SPI.Port.kMXP, CalibrationTime._512ms);
233  }
234
235  /**
236   * Creates a new ADIS16448_IMU object.
237   *
238   * @param yaw_axis The axis that measures the yaw
239   * @param port The SPI Port the gyro is plugged into
240   * @param cal_time Calibration time
241   */
242  @SuppressWarnings("this-escape")
243  public ADIS16448_IMU(final IMUAxis yaw_axis, SPI.Port port, CalibrationTime cal_time) {
244    m_yaw_axis = yaw_axis;
245    m_spi_port = port;
246
247    m_acquire_task = new Thread(this::acquire);
248
249    m_simDevice = SimDevice.create("Gyro:ADIS16448", port.value);
250    if (m_simDevice != null) {
251      m_simConnected = m_simDevice.createBoolean("connected", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, true);
252      m_simGyroAngleX = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_angle_x", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
253      m_simGyroAngleY = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_angle_y", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
254      m_simGyroAngleZ = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_angle_z", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
255      m_simGyroRateX = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_rate_x", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
256      m_simGyroRateY = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_rate_y", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
257      m_simGyroRateZ = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_rate_z", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
258      m_simAccelX = m_simDevice.createDouble("accel_x", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
259      m_simAccelY = m_simDevice.createDouble("accel_y", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
260      m_simAccelZ = m_simDevice.createDouble("accel_z", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
261    }
262
263    if (m_simDevice == null) {
264      // Force the IMU reset pin to toggle on startup (doesn't require DS enable)
265      var reset_out = new DigitalOutput(18); // Drive MXP DIO8 low
266      Timer.delay(0.01);
267      reset_out.close();
268      m_reset_in = new DigitalInput(18); // Set MXP DIO8 high
269      Timer.delay(0.25); // Wait for reset to complete
270
271      configCalTime(cal_time);
272
273      if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
274        return;
275      }
276      boolean needsFlash = false;
277      // Set IMU internal decimation to 1 (ODR = 819.2 SPS / (1 + 1) = 409.6Hz), BW = 204.8Hz
278      if (readRegister(SMPL_PRD) != 0x0001) {
279        writeRegister(SMPL_PRD, 0x0001);
280        needsFlash = true;
281        DriverStation.reportWarning(
282            "ADIS16448: SMPL_PRD register configuration inconsistent! Scheduling flash update.",
283            false);
284      }
285
286      // Set data ready polarity (LOW = Good Data) on DIO1 (PWM0 on MXP)
287      if (readRegister(MSC_CTRL) != 0x0016) {
288        writeRegister(MSC_CTRL, 0x0016);
289        needsFlash = true;
290        DriverStation.reportWarning(
291            "ADIS16448: MSC_CTRL register configuration inconsistent! Scheduling flash update.",
292            false);
293      }
294
295      // Disable IMU internal Bartlett filter (204Hz BW is sufficient) and set IMU scale factor
296      if (readRegister(SENS_AVG) != 0x0400) {
297        writeRegister(SENS_AVG, 0x0400);
298        needsFlash = true;
299        DriverStation.reportWarning(
300            "ADIS16448: SENS_AVG register configuration inconsistent! Scheduling flash update.",
301            false);
302      }
303      // Clear offset registers
304      if (readRegister(XGYRO_OFF) != 0x0000) {
305        writeRegister(XGYRO_OFF, 0x0000);
306        needsFlash = true;
307        DriverStation.reportWarning(
308            "ADIS16448: XGYRO_OFF register configuration inconsistent! Scheduling flash update.",
309            false);
310      }
311
312      if (readRegister(YGYRO_OFF) != 0x0000) {
313        writeRegister(YGYRO_OFF, 0x0000);
314        needsFlash = true;
315        DriverStation.reportWarning(
316            "ADIS16448: YGYRO_OFF register configuration inconsistent! Scheduling flash update.",
317            false);
318      }
319
320      if (readRegister(ZGYRO_OFF) != 0x0000) {
321        writeRegister(ZGYRO_OFF, 0x0000);
322        needsFlash = true;
323        DriverStation.reportWarning(
324            "ADIS16448: ZGYRO_OFF register configuration inconsistent! Scheduling flash update.",
325            false);
326      }
327
328      // If any registers on the IMU don't match the config, trigger a flash update
329      if (needsFlash) {
330        DriverStation.reportWarning(
331            "ADIS16448: Register configuration changed! Starting IMU flash update.", false);
332        writeRegister(GLOB_CMD, 0x0008);
333        // Wait long enough for the flash update to finish (75ms minimum as per the datasheet)
334        Timer.delay(0.5);
335        DriverStation.reportWarning("ADIS16448: Flash update finished!", false);
336      } else {
337        DriverStation.reportWarning(
338            "ADIS16448: Flash and RAM configuration consistent. No flash update required!", false);
339      }
340
341      if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
342        return;
343      }
344      // Notify DS that IMU calibration delay is active
345      DriverStation.reportWarning("ADIS16448: Starting initial calibration delay.", false);
346      // Wait for whatever time the user set as the start-up delay
347      try {
348        Thread.sleep((long) (m_calibration_time.value * 1.2 * 1000));
349      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
350      }
351      // Execute calibration routine and reset accumulated offsets
352      calibrate();
353      // Indicate to the acquire loop that we're done starting up
354      m_start_up_mode = false;
355      // Let the user know the IMU was initialized successfully
356      DriverStation.reportWarning("ADIS16448 IMU Successfully Initialized!", false);
357      // Drive MXP PWM5 (IMU ready LED) low (active low)
358      m_status_led = new DigitalOutput(19);
359    }
360
361    // Report usage and post data to DS
362    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_ADIS16448, 0);
363    m_connected = true;
364  }
365
366  /**
367   * Checks the connection status of the IMU.
368   *
369   * @return True if the IMU is connected, false otherwise.
370   */
371  public boolean isConnected() {
372    if (m_simConnected != null) {
373      return m_simConnected.get();
374    }
375    return m_connected;
376  }
377
378  private static int toUShort(int upper, int lower) {
379    return ((upper & 0xFF) << 8) + (lower & 0xFF);
380  }
381
382  private static int toShort(int upper, int lower) {
383    return (short) (((upper & 0xFF) << 8) + (lower & 0xFF));
384  }
385
386  private boolean switchToStandardSPI() {
387    // Check to see whether the acquire thread is active. If so, wait for it to stop
388    // producing data.
389    if (m_thread_active) {
390      m_thread_active = false;
391      while (!m_thread_idle) {
392        try {
393          Thread.sleep(10);
394        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
395        }
396      }
397      System.out.println("Paused the IMU processing thread successfully!");
398      // Maybe we're in auto SPI mode? If so, kill auto SPI, and then SPI.
399      if (m_spi != null && m_auto_configured) {
400        m_spi.stopAuto();
401        // We need to get rid of all the garbage left in the auto SPI buffer after
402        // stopping it.
403        // Sometimes data magically reappears, so we have to check the buffer size a
404        // couple of times to be sure we got it all. Yuck.
405        int[] trashBuffer = new int[200];
406        try {
407          Thread.sleep(100);
408        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
409        }
410        int data_count = m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(trashBuffer, 0, 0);
411        while (data_count > 0) {
412          // Dequeue 200 at a time, or the remainder of the buffer if less than 200
413          m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(trashBuffer, Math.min(200, data_count), 0);
414          // Update remaining buffer count
415          data_count = m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(trashBuffer, 0, 0);
416        }
417        System.out.println("Paused auto SPI successfully.");
418      }
419    }
420    if (m_spi == null) {
421      m_spi = new SPI(m_spi_port);
422      m_spi.setClockRate(1000000);
423      m_spi.setMode(SPI.Mode.kMode3);
424      m_spi.setChipSelectActiveLow();
425    }
426    readRegister(PROD_ID); // Dummy read
427    // Validate the product ID
428    if (readRegister(PROD_ID) != 16448) {
429      DriverStation.reportError("Could not find ADIS16448", false);
430      close();
431      return false;
432    }
433    return true;
434  }
435
436  boolean switchToAutoSPI() {
437    // No SPI port has been set up. Go set one up first.
438    if (m_spi == null && !switchToStandardSPI()) {
439      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to start/restart auto SPI", false);
440      return false;
441    }
442    // Only set up the interrupt if needed.
443    if (m_auto_interrupt == null) {
444      m_auto_interrupt = new DigitalInput(10); // MXP DIO0
445    }
446    // The auto SPI controller gets angry if you try to set up two instances on one
447    // bus.
448    if (!m_auto_configured) {
449      m_spi.initAuto(8200);
450      m_auto_configured = true;
451    }
452    // Set auto SPI packet data and size
453    m_spi.setAutoTransmitData(new byte[] {GLOB_CMD}, 27);
454    // Configure auto stall time
455    m_spi.configureAutoStall(100, 1000, 255);
456    // Kick off auto SPI (Note: Device configuration impossible after auto SPI is
457    // activated)
458    m_spi.startAutoTrigger(m_auto_interrupt, true, false);
459    // Check to see if the acquire thread is running. If not, kick one off.
460    if (!m_acquire_task.isAlive()) {
461      m_first_run = true;
462      m_thread_active = true;
463      m_acquire_task.start();
464      System.out.println("New IMU Processing thread activated!");
465    } else {
466      // The thread was running, re-init run variables and start it up again.
467      m_first_run = true;
468      m_thread_active = true;
469      System.out.println("Old IMU Processing thread re-activated!");
470    }
471    // Looks like the thread didn't start for some reason. Abort.
472    if (!m_acquire_task.isAlive()) {
473      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to start/restart the acquire() thread.", false);
474      close();
475      return false;
476    }
477    return true;
478  }
479
480  /**
481   * Configures the decimation rate of the IMU.
482   *
483   * @param decimationRate The new decimation value.
484   * @return 0 if success, 1 if no change, 2 if error.
485   */
486  public int configDecRate(int decimationRate) {
487    // Switches the active SPI port to standard SPI mode, writes a new value to the DECIMATE
488    // register in the IMU, adjusts the sample scale factor, and re-enables auto SPI.
489    if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
490      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure standard SPI.", false);
491      return 2;
492    }
493
494    // Check max
495    if (decimationRate > 9) {
496      DriverStation.reportError(
497          "Attempted to write an invalid decimation value. Capping at 9", false);
498      decimationRate = 9;
499    }
500    if (decimationRate < 0) {
501      DriverStation.reportError(
502          "Attempted to write an invalid decimation value. Capping at 0", false);
503      decimationRate = 0;
504    }
505
506    // Shift decimation setting to correct position and select internal sync
507    int writeValue = (decimationRate << 8) | 0x1;
508
509    // Apply to IMU
510    writeRegister(SMPL_PRD, writeValue);
511
512    // Perform read back to verify write
513    int readbackValue = readRegister(SMPL_PRD);
514
515    // Throw error for invalid write
516    if (readbackValue != writeValue) {
517      DriverStation.reportError("ADIS16448 SMPL_PRD write failed.", false);
518    }
519
520    if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
521      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure auto SPI.", false);
522      return 2;
523    }
524    return 0;
525  }
526
527  /**
528   * Configures calibration time.
529   *
530   * @param new_cal_time New calibration time
531   * @return 1 if the new calibration time is the same as the current one else 0
532   */
533  public final int configCalTime(CalibrationTime new_cal_time) {
534    if (m_calibration_time == new_cal_time) {
535      return 1;
536    } else {
537      m_calibration_time = new_cal_time;
538      m_avg_size = m_calibration_time.value * 819;
539      initOffsetBuffer(m_avg_size);
540      return 0;
541    }
542  }
543
544  private void initOffsetBuffer(int size) {
545    // Avoid exceptions in the case of bad arguments
546    if (size < 1) {
547      size = 1;
548    }
549    // Set average size to size (correct bad values)
550    m_avg_size = size;
551    synchronized (this) {
552      // Resize vector
553      m_offset_data_gyro_rate_x = new double[size];
554      m_offset_data_gyro_rate_y = new double[size];
555      m_offset_data_gyro_rate_z = new double[size];
556      // Set accumulate count to 0
557      m_accum_count = 0;
558    }
559  }
560
561  /**
562   * Calibrate the gyro. It's important to make sure that the robot is not moving while the
563   * calibration is in progress, this is typically done when the robot is first turned on while it's
564   * sitting at rest before the match starts.
565   */
566  public void calibrate() {
567    synchronized (this) {
568      int gyroAverageSize = Math.min(m_accum_count, m_avg_size);
569      double accum_gyro_rate_x = 0.0;
570      double accum_gyro_rate_y = 0.0;
571      double accum_gyro_rate_z = 0.0;
572      for (int i = 0; i < gyroAverageSize; i++) {
573        accum_gyro_rate_x += m_offset_data_gyro_rate_x[i];
574        accum_gyro_rate_y += m_offset_data_gyro_rate_y[i];
575        accum_gyro_rate_z += m_offset_data_gyro_rate_z[i];
576      }
577      m_gyro_rate_offset_x = accum_gyro_rate_x / gyroAverageSize;
578      m_gyro_rate_offset_y = accum_gyro_rate_y / gyroAverageSize;
579      m_gyro_rate_offset_z = accum_gyro_rate_z / gyroAverageSize;
580      reset();
581    }
582  }
583
584  /**
585   * Sets the yaw axis.
586   *
587   * @param yaw_axis The new yaw axis to use
588   * @return 1 if the new yaw axis is the same as the current one else 0.
589   */
590  public int setYawAxis(IMUAxis yaw_axis) {
591    if (m_yaw_axis == yaw_axis) {
592      return 1;
593    }
594    m_yaw_axis = yaw_axis;
595    reset();
596    return 0;
597  }
598
599  private int readRegister(final int reg) {
600    final byte[] buf = {(byte) (reg & 0x7f), 0};
601
602    m_spi.write(buf, 2);
603    m_spi.read(false, buf, 2);
604
605    return toUShort(buf[0], buf[1]);
606  }
607
608  private void writeRegister(final int reg, final int val) {
609    final byte[] buf = new byte[2];
610    // low byte
611    buf[0] = (byte) (0x80 | reg);
612    buf[1] = (byte) (val & 0xff);
613    m_spi.write(buf, 2);
614    // high byte
615    buf[0] = (byte) (0x81 | reg);
616    buf[1] = (byte) (val >> 8);
617    m_spi.write(buf, 2);
618  }
619
620  /**
621   * Reset the gyro.
622   *
623   * <p>Resets the gyro accumulations to a heading of zero. This can be used if there is significant
624   * drift in the gyro and it needs to be recalibrated after running.
625   */
626  public void reset() {
627    synchronized (this) {
628      m_integ_gyro_angle_x = 0.0;
629      m_integ_gyro_angle_y = 0.0;
630      m_integ_gyro_angle_z = 0.0;
631    }
632  }
633
634  /** Delete (free) the spi port used for the IMU. */
635  @Override
636  public void close() {
637    if (m_thread_active) {
638      m_thread_active = false;
639      try {
640        if (m_acquire_task != null) {
641          m_acquire_task.join();
642          m_acquire_task = null;
643        }
644      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
645      }
646      if (m_spi != null) {
647        if (m_auto_configured) {
648          m_spi.stopAuto();
649        }
650        m_spi.close();
651        m_auto_configured = false;
652        if (m_auto_interrupt != null) {
653          m_auto_interrupt.close();
654          m_auto_interrupt = null;
655        }
656        m_spi = null;
657      }
658    }
659    if (m_simDevice != null) {
660      m_simDevice.close();
661      m_simDevice = null;
662    }
663    System.out.println("Finished cleaning up after the IMU driver.");
664  }
665
666  private void acquire() {
667    // Set data packet length
668    final int dataset_len = 29; // 18 data points + timestamp
669    final int BUFFER_SIZE = 4000;
670
671    // Set up buffers and variables
672    int[] buffer = new int[BUFFER_SIZE];
673    double previous_timestamp = 0.0;
674    double compAngleX = 0.0;
675    double compAngleY = 0.0;
676    while (true) {
677      // Wait for data
678      try {
679        Thread.sleep(5);
680      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
681      }
682
683      if (m_thread_active) {
684        m_thread_idle = false;
685
686        // Read number of bytes currently stored in the buffer
687        int data_count = m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(buffer, 0, 0);
688        // Check if frame is incomplete
689        int data_remainder = data_count % dataset_len;
690        // Remove incomplete data from read count
691        int data_to_read = data_count - data_remainder;
692        if (data_to_read > BUFFER_SIZE) {
693          DriverStation.reportWarning(
694              "ADIS16448 data processing thread overrun has occurred!", false);
695          data_to_read = BUFFER_SIZE - (BUFFER_SIZE % dataset_len);
696        }
697        // Read data from DMA buffer (only complete sets)
698        m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(buffer, data_to_read, 0);
699
700        // Could be multiple data sets in the buffer. Handle each one.
701        for (int i = 0; i < data_to_read; i += dataset_len) {
702          // Calculate CRC-16 on each data packet
703          int calc_crc = 0xFFFF; // Starting word
704          // Cycle through XYZ GYRO, XYZ ACCEL, XYZ MAG, BARO, TEMP (Ignore Status & CRC)
705          for (int k = 5; k < 27; k += 2) {
706            // Process LSB
707            calc_crc = (calc_crc >>> 8) ^ m_adiscrc[(calc_crc & 0xFF) ^ buffer[i + k + 1]];
708            // Process MSB
709            calc_crc = (calc_crc >>> 8) ^ m_adiscrc[(calc_crc & 0xFF) ^ buffer[i + k]];
710          }
711          // Complement
712          calc_crc = ~calc_crc & 0xFFFF;
713          // Flip LSB & MSB
714          calc_crc = ((calc_crc << 8) | (calc_crc >> 8)) & 0xFFFF;
715          // Extract DUT CRC from data buffer
716          int imu_crc = toUShort(buffer[i + 27], buffer[i + 28]);
717
718          if (calc_crc == imu_crc) {
719            // Timestamp is at buffer[i]
720            m_dt = (buffer[i] - previous_timestamp) / 1000000.0;
721
722            // Scale sensor data
723            double gyro_rate_x = toShort(buffer[i + 5], buffer[i + 6]) * 0.04;
724            double gyro_rate_y = toShort(buffer[i + 7], buffer[i + 8]) * 0.04;
725            double gyro_rate_z = toShort(buffer[i + 9], buffer[i + 10]) * 0.04;
726            double accel_x = toShort(buffer[i + 11], buffer[i + 12]) * 0.833;
727            double accel_y = toShort(buffer[i + 13], buffer[i + 14]) * 0.833;
728            double accel_z = toShort(buffer[i + 15], buffer[i + 16]) * 0.833;
729            double mag_x = toShort(buffer[i + 17], buffer[i + 18]) * 0.1429;
730            double mag_y = toShort(buffer[i + 19], buffer[i + 20]) * 0.1429;
731            double mag_z = toShort(buffer[i + 21], buffer[i + 22]) * 0.1429;
732            double baro = toShort(buffer[i + 23], buffer[i + 24]) * 0.02;
733            double temp = toShort(buffer[i + 25], buffer[i + 26]) * 0.07386 + 31.0;
734
735            // Convert scaled sensor data to SI units (for tilt calculations)
736            // TODO: Should the unit outputs be selectable?
737            double gyro_rate_x_si = Math.toRadians(gyro_rate_x);
738            double gyro_rate_y_si = Math.toRadians(gyro_rate_y);
739            // double gyro_rate_z_si = Math.toRadians(gyro_rate_z);
740            double accel_x_si = accel_x * kGrav;
741            double accel_y_si = accel_y * kGrav;
742            double accel_z_si = accel_z * kGrav;
743            // Store timestamp for next iteration
744            previous_timestamp = buffer[i];
745            // Calculate alpha for use with the complementary filter
746            m_alpha = kTau / (kTau + m_dt);
747            // Run inclinometer calculations
748            double accelAngleX = Math.atan2(-accel_x_si, Math.hypot(accel_y_si, -accel_z_si));
749            double accelAngleY = Math.atan2(accel_y_si, Math.hypot(-accel_x_si, -accel_z_si));
750            // Calculate complementary filter
751            if (m_first_run) {
752              compAngleX = accelAngleX;
753              compAngleY = accelAngleY;
754            } else {
755              accelAngleX = formatAccelRange(accelAngleX, -accel_z_si);
756              accelAngleY = formatAccelRange(accelAngleY, -accel_z_si);
757              compAngleX = compFilterProcess(compAngleX, accelAngleX, -gyro_rate_y_si);
758              compAngleY = compFilterProcess(compAngleY, accelAngleY, -gyro_rate_x_si);
759            }
760
761            // Update global variables and state
762            synchronized (this) {
763              // Ignore first, integrated sample
764              if (m_first_run) {
765                reset();
766              } else {
767                // Accumulate gyro for offset calibration
768                // Add to buffer
769                int bufferAvgIndex = m_accum_count % m_avg_size;
770                m_offset_data_gyro_rate_x[bufferAvgIndex] = gyro_rate_x;
771                m_offset_data_gyro_rate_y[bufferAvgIndex] = gyro_rate_y;
772                m_offset_data_gyro_rate_z[bufferAvgIndex] = gyro_rate_z;
773                // Increment counter
774                m_accum_count++;
775              }
776              if (!m_start_up_mode) {
777                m_gyro_rate_x = gyro_rate_x;
778                m_gyro_rate_y = gyro_rate_y;
779                m_gyro_rate_z = gyro_rate_z;
780                m_accel_x = accel_x;
781                m_accel_y = accel_y;
782                m_accel_z = accel_z;
783                m_mag_x = mag_x;
784                m_mag_y = mag_y;
785                m_mag_z = mag_z;
786                m_baro = baro;
787                m_temp = temp;
788                m_compAngleX = Math.toDegrees(compAngleX);
789                m_compAngleY = Math.toDegrees(compAngleY);
790                m_accelAngleX = Math.toDegrees(accelAngleX);
791                m_accelAngleY = Math.toDegrees(accelAngleY);
792                // Accumulate gyro for angle integration and publish to global variables
793                m_integ_gyro_angle_x += (gyro_rate_x - m_gyro_rate_offset_x) * m_dt;
794                m_integ_gyro_angle_y += (gyro_rate_y - m_gyro_rate_offset_y) * m_dt;
795                m_integ_gyro_angle_z += (gyro_rate_z - m_gyro_rate_offset_z) * m_dt;
796              }
797            }
798            m_first_run = false;
799          }
800        }
801      } else {
802        m_thread_idle = true;
803        previous_timestamp = 0.0;
804        compAngleX = 0.0;
805        compAngleY = 0.0;
806      }
807    }
808  }
809
810  private double formatFastConverge(double compAngle, double accAngle) {
811    if (compAngle > accAngle + Math.PI) {
812      compAngle = compAngle - 2.0 * Math.PI;
813    } else if (accAngle > compAngle + Math.PI) {
814      compAngle = compAngle + 2.0 * Math.PI;
815    }
816    return compAngle;
817  }
818
819  private double formatAccelRange(double accelAngle, double accelZ) {
820    if (accelZ < 0.0) {
821      accelAngle = Math.PI - accelAngle;
822    } else if (accelZ > 0.0 && accelAngle < 0.0) {
823      accelAngle = 2.0 * Math.PI + accelAngle;
824    }
825    return accelAngle;
826  }
827
828  private double compFilterProcess(double compAngle, double accelAngle, double omega) {
829    compAngle = formatFastConverge(compAngle, accelAngle);
830    compAngle = m_alpha * (compAngle + omega * m_dt) + (1.0 - m_alpha) * accelAngle;
831    return MathUtil.angleModulus(compAngle);
832  }
833
834  /**
835   * Returns the yaw axis angle in degrees (CCW positive).
836   *
837   * @return Yaw axis angle in degrees (CCW positive).
838   */
839  public synchronized double getAngle() {
840    return switch (m_yaw_axis) {
841      case kX -> getGyroAngleX();
842      case kY -> getGyroAngleY();
843      case kZ -> getGyroAngleZ();
844    };
845  }
846
847  /**
848   * Returns the yaw axis angular rate in degrees per second (CCW positive).
849   *
850   * @return Yaw axis angular rate in degrees per second (CCW positive).
851   */
852  public synchronized double getRate() {
853    return switch (m_yaw_axis) {
854      case kX -> getGyroRateX();
855      case kY -> getGyroRateY();
856      case kZ -> getGyroRateZ();
857    };
858  }
859
860  /**
861   * Returns which axis, kX, kY, or kZ, is set to the yaw axis.
862   *
863   * @return IMUAxis Yaw Axis
864   */
865  public IMUAxis getYawAxis() {
866    return m_yaw_axis;
867  }
868
869  /**
870   * Returns the accumulated gyro angle in the X axis in degrees.
871   *
872   * @return The accumulated gyro angle in the X axis in degrees.
873   */
874  public synchronized double getGyroAngleX() {
875    if (m_simGyroAngleX != null) {
876      return m_simGyroAngleX.get();
877    }
878    return m_integ_gyro_angle_x;
879  }
880
881  /**
882   * Returns the accumulated gyro angle in the Y axis in degrees.
883   *
884   * @return The accumulated gyro angle in the Y axis in degrees.
885   */
886  public synchronized double getGyroAngleY() {
887    if (m_simGyroAngleY != null) {
888      return m_simGyroAngleY.get();
889    }
890    return m_integ_gyro_angle_y;
891  }
892
893  /**
894   * Returns the accumulated gyro angle in the Z axis in degrees.
895   *
896   * @return The accumulated gyro angle in the Z axis in degrees.
897   */
898  public synchronized double getGyroAngleZ() {
899    if (m_simGyroAngleZ != null) {
900      return m_simGyroAngleZ.get();
901    }
902    return m_integ_gyro_angle_z;
903  }
904
905  /**
906   * Returns the gyro angular rate in the X axis in degrees per second.
907   *
908   * @return The gyro angular rate in the X axis in degrees per second.
909   */
910  public synchronized double getGyroRateX() {
911    if (m_simGyroRateX != null) {
912      return m_simGyroRateX.get();
913    }
914    return m_gyro_rate_x;
915  }
916
917  /**
918   * Returns the gyro angular rate in the Y axis in degrees per second.
919   *
920   * @return The gyro angular rate in the Y axis in degrees per second.
921   */
922  public synchronized double getGyroRateY() {
923    if (m_simGyroRateY != null) {
924      return m_simGyroRateY.get();
925    }
926    return m_gyro_rate_y;
927  }
928
929  /**
930   * Returns the gyro angular rate in the Z axis in degrees per second.
931   *
932   * @return The gyro angular rate in the Z axis in degrees per second.
933   */
934  public synchronized double getGyroRateZ() {
935    if (m_simGyroRateZ != null) {
936      return m_simGyroRateZ.get();
937    }
938    return m_gyro_rate_z;
939  }
940
941  /**
942   * Returns the acceleration in the X axis in meters per second squared.
943   *
944   * @return The acceleration in the X axis in meters per second squared.
945   */
946  public synchronized double getAccelX() {
947    if (m_simAccelX != null) {
948      return m_simAccelX.get();
949    }
950    return m_accel_x * kGrav;
951  }
952
953  /**
954   * Returns the acceleration in the Y axis in meters per second squared.
955   *
956   * @return The acceleration in the Y axis in meters per second squared.
957   */
958  public synchronized double getAccelY() {
959    if (m_simAccelY != null) {
960      return m_simAccelY.get();
961    }
962    return m_accel_y * kGrav;
963  }
964
965  /**
966   * Returns the acceleration in the Z axis in meters per second squared.
967   *
968   * @return The acceleration in the Z axis in meters per second squared.
969   */
970  public synchronized double getAccelZ() {
971    if (m_simAccelZ != null) {
972      return m_simAccelZ.get();
973    }
974    return m_accel_z * kGrav;
975  }
976
977  /**
978   * Returns the magnetic field strength in the X axis in Tesla.
979   *
980   * @return The magnetic field strength in the X axis in Tesla.
981   */
982  public synchronized double getMagneticFieldX() {
983    // mG to T
984    return m_mag_x * 1e-7;
985  }
986
987  /**
988   * Returns the magnetic field strength in the Y axis in Tesla.
989   *
990   * @return The magnetic field strength in the Y axis in Tesla.
991   */
992  public synchronized double getMagneticFieldY() {
993    // mG to T
994    return m_mag_y * 1e-7;
995  }
996
997  /**
998   * Returns the magnetic field strength in the Z axis in Tesla.
999   *
1000   * @return The magnetic field strength in the Z axis in Tesla.
1001   */
1002  public synchronized double getMagneticFieldZ() {
1003    // mG to T
1004    return m_mag_z * 1e-7;
1005  }
1006
1007  /**
1008   * Returns the complementary angle around the X axis computed from accelerometer and gyro rate
1009   * measurements.
1010   *
1011   * @return The X-axis complementary angle in degrees.
1012   */
1013  public synchronized double getXComplementaryAngle() {
1014    return m_compAngleX;
1015  }
1016
1017  /**
1018   * Returns the complementary angle around the Y axis computed from accelerometer and gyro rate
1019   * measurements.
1020   *
1021   * @return The Y-axis complementary angle in degrees.
1022   */
1023  public synchronized double getYComplementaryAngle() {
1024    return m_compAngleY;
1025  }
1026
1027  /**
1028   * Returns the X-axis filtered acceleration angle in degrees.
1029   *
1030   * @return The X-axis filtered acceleration angle in degrees.
1031   */
1032  public synchronized double getXFilteredAccelAngle() {
1033    return m_accelAngleX;
1034  }
1035
1036  /**
1037   * Returns the Y-axis filtered acceleration angle in degrees.
1038   *
1039   * @return The Y-axis filtered acceleration angle in degrees.
1040   */
1041  public synchronized double getYFilteredAccelAngle() {
1042    return m_accelAngleY;
1043  }
1044
1045  /**
1046   * Returns the barometric pressure in PSI.
1047   *
1048   * @return The barometric pressure in PSI.
1049   */
1050  public synchronized double getBarometricPressure() {
1051    // mbar to PSI conversion
1052    return m_baro * 0.0145;
1053  }
1054
1055  /**
1056   * Returns the temperature in degrees Celsius.
1057   *
1058   * @return The temperature in degrees Celsius.
1059   */
1060  public synchronized double getTemperature() {
1061    return m_temp;
1062  }
1063
1064  /**
1065   * Get the SPI port number.
1066   *
1067   * @return The SPI port number.
1068   */
1069  public int getPort() {
1070    return m_spi_port.value;
1071  }
1072
1073  @Override
1074  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {
1075    builder.setSmartDashboardType("Gyro");
1076    builder.addDoubleProperty("Value", this::getAngle, null);
1077  }
1078}
